charges.charge_disposition: 60 months imprisonment to be served concurrently on each count. 60 months supervised release to run concurrently on each count. 1.The defendant is prohibited from possessing a firearm, destructive device, or other dangerous weapon. 2.The defendant is to participate in a sex offender specific treatment program which may include sex offender specific testing at the direction of the Probation Office. The defendant shall be required to contribute to the costs of services for such treatment based on the ability to pay or availability of third-party payment. 3. The defendant is prohibited from engaging in an occupation, business, or profession that would require or enable him to have direct or indirect supervision with children under 18 years of age and is not to have unsupervised contact with children under 18 years of age. 4. The defendant is prohibited from possessing a computer and /or related materials except as deemed necessary for work purposes. 5. The defendant shall register as a sex offender as required in any state where he resides, is employed, carries on a vocation, or is a student. 6. The defendant shall be required to submit to periodic polygraph testing as a means to insure that he is in compliance with the requirements of his therapeutic program. No violation proceedings will arise base solely on a defendants failure to pass the polygraph. Such an event could, however, generate a separate investigation. When submitting to a polygraph exam, the defendant does not waive his fifth amendment rights, and the defendants exercise of his fifth amendment rights will not give rise to violation proceedings. The defendant shall be required to contribute to the cost of testing based on ability to pay or third party payment. 7. The defendant shall allow the U.S. Probation Office to install software (IPPC) designed to monitor computer activities on any computer the defendant is authorized to uses. This may include, but is not limited to, software, that may record any and all activity on the computers the defendant may use, including the capture of keystrokes, application information, internet uses history, email correspondence, and chat conversations. The defendant will pay any cost related to the monitoring of his computer usage. 8. The defendant shall report his address and any subsequent address changes to Probation Office. Special assessment fee of $400 to be paid immediately. Defendant to report to BOP on 12/12/11
